docs.abstract: To expand the pool of workers, companies are recruiting stay-at-home parents, retirees and people with disabilities. Will they keep it up if the economy sours?
docs.snippet: To expand the pool of workers, companies are recruiting stay-at-home parents, retirees and people with disabilities. Will they keep it up if the economy sours?
docs.lead_paragraph: ROUND ROCK, Tex. — When Kate Cosway completed her master’s degree in 2014, her résumé drew plenty of interest, but she rarely advanced far in the hiring process. She was pretty sure she knew why: She is on the autism spectrum and struggles in traditional interviews.

headline.main: In a Tight Labor Market, a Disability May Not Be a Barrier
headline.print_headline: In a Tight Labor Market, Hiring Rules Loosen Up

docs.abstract: Here are five questions that were presented to a computer system from the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence, a prominent lab in Seattle.
docs.snippet: Here are five questions that were presented to a computer system from the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence, a prominent lab in Seattle.
docs.lead_paragraph: Here are five questions that were presented to a computer system from the Allen Institute for Artificial Intelligence, a prominent lab in Seattle.

headline.main: Match Wits With Aristo on 5 Quiz Questions

docs.abstract: Worker organizing is often being done with little union involvement or help. “It’s an opportunity being squandered,” one former labor official said.
docs.snippet: Worker organizing is often being done with little union involvement or help. “It’s an opportunity being squandered,” one former labor official said.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — When a group of workers at the video-game maker Riot Games staged a three-hour walkout in May over the company’s handling of sex discrimination accusations, they had help from a labor organizer named Emma Kinema.

headline.main: As Grass-Roots Labor Activism Rises, Will Unions Take Advantage?
headline.print_headline: As Workers Get Bolder, Will Unions Capitalize?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: AMERICAN FEDERATION OF LABOR-CONGRESS OF INDUSTRIAL ORGANIZATIONS

docs.abstract: As part of a settlement, YouTube said it would also institute new privacy measures on children’s videos. Critics said the changes did not go far enough to protect children.
docs.snippet: As part of a settlement, YouTube said it would also institute new privacy measures on children’s videos. Critics said the changes did not go far enough to protect children.
docs.lead_paragraph: Google agreed on Wednesday to pay a record $170 million fine and make changes to protect children’s privacy on YouTube, as regulators said the video site had knowingly and illegally harvested personal information from children and used it to profit by targeting them with ads.

headline.main: Google Is Fined $170 Million for Violating Children’s Privacy on YouTube
headline.print_headline: Google Fined $170 Million For Tracking Of Children

byline.original: By Natasha Singer and Kate Conger

docs.abstract: Denmark appointed him to approach Silicon Valley as if it were a global superpower. His challenges show how smaller countries struggle to influence giant corporations.
docs.snippet: Denmark appointed him to approach Silicon Valley as if it were a global superpower. His challenges show how smaller countries struggle to influence giant corporations.
docs.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN — Casper Klynge, a career diplomat from Denmark, has worked in some of the world’s most turbulent places. He once spent 18 months embroiled in reconstruction efforts in Afghanistan. For two years, he led a crisis management mission in Kosovo.

headline.main: The World’s First Ambassador to the Tech Industry
headline.print_headline: When Tech Firms Are Superpowers, Send an Ambassador

docs.abstract: Doug McMillon, Walmart’s chief executive, said the company would stop selling certain types of guns and ammunition. This should be an example for corporate America.
docs.snippet: Doug McMillon, Walmart’s chief executive, said the company would stop selling certain types of guns and ammunition. This should be an example for corporate America.
docs.lead_paragraph: Midday Tuesday, Doug McMillon, Walmart’s chief executive, sent me a surprise email. He shared a series of policies the company was about to make public about combating gun violence since the mass shooting that killed 22 people at one of his El Paso stores last month.

headline.main: Walmart’s C.E.O. Steps Into the Gun Debate. Other C.E.O.s Should Follow.
headline.print_headline: Big Business Gets Lesson From Chief Of Walmart

docs.abstract: In a closely watched case, a judge ruled that live facial recognition does not violate privacy rights. There has been little legal precedent about its use.
docs.snippet: In a closely watched case, a judge ruled that live facial recognition does not violate privacy rights. There has been little legal precedent about its use.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In one of the first lawsuits to address the use of live facial recognition technology by governments, a British court ruled on Wednesday that police use of the systems is acceptable and does not violate privacy and human rights.

headline.main: Police Use of Facial Recognition Is Accepted by British Court
headline.print_headline: Use of Facial Recognition Approved for British Police

docs.abstract: With $1 billion to work with, the veteran Hollywood executive finds more material for his short-form video platform.
docs.snippet: With $1 billion to work with, the veteran Hollywood executive finds more material for his short-form video platform.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Quibi’s latest partner is ESPN.

headline.main: Jeffrey Katzenberg’s Mobile Start-Up, Quibi, Makes a Deal With ESPN
headline.print_headline: Quibi Gets Video Deal For Content From ESPN

docs.abstract: A company that handles the federal government’s troubled Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program failed in its most basic tasks, the lawsuit said.
docs.snippet: A company that handles the federal government’s troubled Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program failed in its most basic tasks, the lawsuit said.
docs.lead_paragraph: The student loan servicer that manages a deeply troubled program intended to forgive public servants’ education debts failed in its most basic tasks, depriving thousands of borrowers of a benefit they had earned, New York’s attorney general said in a federal lawsuit filed Thursday.

headline.main: New York Sues Student Loan Servicer for ‘Abusive’ Acts

docs.abstract: The network declined to run a pair of 30-second ads that express the president’s view of the impeachment inquiry, calling them “demonstrably false.”
docs.snippet: The network declined to run a pair of 30-second ads that express the president’s view of the impeachment inquiry, calling them “demonstrably false.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The 2020 campaign ad wars have begun.

headline.main: CNN Rejects 2 Trump Campaign Ads, Citing Inaccuracies
headline.print_headline: CNN Rejects Two Ads From Trump Campaign, Calling Them ‘Demonstrably False’

byline.original: By Michael M. Grynbaum and Tiffany Hsu
